page.title: 10FARMING - GENERAL
page.content: We live in a farming community - the majority of the farms are owned by the Wiltshire County Council. In Keevil, the 80-acre Longleaze Farm is owned and run by the third generation of Banfield's, Mr James Banfield and his family, and consists of 60 dairy cows in milk, with 20 calves a year. Although they have no crops, there is corn and kale grown in the area. In Bulkington, there are 9 farms, each employing about 2 workers, but the majority of workers on farms are members of the family. 5 of the farms are dairy, 1 is a pig farm, 1 is arable,sheep & beef,and 2 are poultry. Many farmers in the area have been adversely affected by the recent EEC regulations concerning milk production This has caused some disillusionment amongst young farmers with regard to the future of the industry.
